com.orange.links.client
Class DiagramController

java.lang.Object
  com.orange.links.client.DiagramController
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, ChangeOnDiagramEvent.HasChangeOnDiagramHandlers, TieLinkEvent.HasTieLinkHandlers, UntieLinkEvent.HasUntieLinkHandlers
public class DiagramController
extends java.lang.Object
implements TieLinkEvent.HasTieLinkHandlers, UntieLinkEvent.HasUntieLinkHandlers, ChangeOnDiagramEvent.HasChangeOnDiagramHandlers

Controller which manage all the diagram logic

Author:
Pierre Renaudin (pierre.renaudin.fr@gmail.com)

Field Detail

minDistanceToSegment

public static int minDistanceToSegment
If the distance between the mouse and segment is under this number in pixels, then, the mouse is considered over the segment

refreshRate

public static int refreshRate
Timer refresh duration, in milliseconds. It defers if the application is running in development mode or in the web mode

Constructor Detail

DiagramController

public DiagramController(DiagramCanvas canvas)
Initialize the controller diagram. Use this constructor to start your diagram. An code sample is :

DiagramCanvas canvas = new MultiBrowserDiagramCanvas(400,400);
DiagramController controller = new DiagramController(canvas);

Parameters:
canvas - the implementation of the canvas where connections and widgets will be drawn

public Connection drawStraightArrowConnection(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget startWidget,
                                              com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget endWidget)
Draw a straight connection with an arrow between two GWT widgets. The arrow is pointing to the second widget

Parameters:
startWidget - Start widget
endWidget - End Widget
Returns:
the created new connection between the two widgets

showGrid - if true, show a grid, else don't
